posts.post_content:
Beware of the [Kormus Bell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kormus Bell)'s toll...it signals the beginning of the [Nightcreep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nightcreep) to [Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth). The [Spawning Pit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spawning Pit)s become filled, then emptied if tribute has been paid at [Ashnod's Altar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashnod's Altar).
  
   
Some nights, when the air is deathly still, you may hear the [Xanthic Statue](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Xanthic Statue)'s victims, screaming in terror!

Posted By: Belz_ (4/17/2010 4:18:22 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's a shame [Tajuru Preserver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tajuru Preserver) only works on enemy spells.  
  
I'm not a big fan of the art. It seems too shiny and high-contrast.  
  
I got one of these, and I have four [Painter's Servants](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painter's Servants), so I've been trying to come up with a practical way to use the two together. So far no good. The closest I can think of is to [Moonlace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moonlace) [Reya Dawnbringer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reya Dawnbringer) or something, but that's just way too clunky. Four cards together, two of which are huge, is more than you should need to get an unrecoverable lead. Still, it might be fun for a casual deck.
posts.html:
It's a shame Tajuru Preserver only works on enemy spells.

I'm not a big fan of the art. It seems too shiny and high-contrast.
